meta.appropriation_name: Research, Development, Test & Evaluation, Air Force

AppropriationName.val: Research, Development, Test & Evaluation, Air Force

ProgramElementNote.val: In FY 2013, Project 674820, Sensor Development, includes new start efforts.

ProgramElementMissionDescription.val:
The CIA established the Senior Year Program in 1955.  The program has evolved to include the U-2 airframe, engines, sensors, cameras, recorders, data links life support systems, test facilities, and equipment.   The U-2S model airframes were constructed in the late 1980s, with the last aircraft rolling off the assembly line in 1989.  The U-2S provides global reconnaissance signals intelligence (SIGINT) and geospatial intelligence (GEOINT) 24 hours a day, seven days a week in support of national and DoD worldwide missions.  The U-2 is currently deployed to forward operating locations (FOL) around the world. 

FY13 funding includes Lithium-Ion Battery, U-2 Sump Tank, U-2 Global Positioning System (GPS) Receiver, and Fuel conversion.

FY14 funding includes Advanced Synthetic Aperature Radar System (ASARS) Next Generation, Generator Upgrade/Accessory Mounted Auxiliary Drive (AMAD), Avionics Processor/Airborne Recce Toolkit (ART) Analysis, Conformal Equipment Group, Airborne Signet Intelligence Payload (ASIP) Dual Pod Only and Inertial Navigation System (INS) Upgrade/GPS Tech Refresh.

Activities also include, but are not limited to support both current program planning and execution, and future program planning.  

This program is in Budget Activity 7, Operational System Development because this budget activity includes development efforts to upgrade systems that have been fielded or have received approval for full rate production and anticipate production funding in the current or subsequent fiscal year.

ProjectMissionDescription.val:
The CIA established the Senior Year Program in 1955.  The program has evolved to include the U-2 airframe, engines, sensors, cameras, recorders, data links life support systems, test facilities, and equipment.   The U-2S model airframes were constructed in the late 1980s, with the last aircraft rolling off the assembly line in 1989.  The U-2S provides global reconnaissance signals intelligence (SIGINT) and geospatial intelligence (GEOINT) 24 hours a day, seven days a week in support of national and DoD worldwide missions.  The U-2 is currently deployed to forward operating locations (FOL) around the world. 

FY13 funding includes Lithium-Ion Battery, U-2 Sump Tank, U-2 Global Positioning System (GPS) Receiver, and Fuel conversion.

FY14 funding includes Advanced Synthetic Aperature Radar System (ASARS) Next Generation, Generator Upgrade/Accessory Mounted Auxiliary Drive (AMAD), Avionics Processor/Airborne Recce Toolkit (ART) Analysis, Conformal Equipment Group, Airborne Signet Intelligence Payload (ASIP) Dual Pod Only and Inertial Navigation System (INS) Upgrade/GPS Tech Refresh.

Activities also include, but are not limited to support both current program planning and execution, and future program planning.  

This program is in Budget Activity 7, Operational System Development because this budget activity includes development efforts to upgrade systems that have been fielded or have received approval for full rate production and anticipate production funding in the current or subsequent fiscal year.

Description.val: Provides extended power availability with loss of engine/generator during flight.

Text.val: Complete development of Li-Ion Battery replacement.

Description.val: Develop new composite material sump tank to replace current aluminum sump tank.

Text.val: Complete development of new composite material tank.

Description.val: Develop a replacement GPS receiver for the U-2 to address vanishing vendor issue/diminishing manufacturing sources (VVI/DMS) issues.

Text.val: Complete development of a replacement U-2 GPS receiver, a critical navigation component

Description.val: Identify a replacement option for Jet Propellant Thermally Stable (JPTS) fuel, the current high altitude fuel.

Text.val: Complete testing a JP8 additive for use with U-2, leading towards its certification.

Description.val: Funds for the management of the program to include travel, A&AS contracts and any other PMA requirements.

Text.val: Provide for the management of the program to include travel, A&AS contracts and any other PMA requirements.
Will continue providing for the management of the program to include travel, A&AS contracts and any other PMA requirements.

Title.val: Advanced Synthetic Aperature Radar System (ASARS) Next Generation

Description.val: Reduce ASARS footprint to nose only installation with smaller process and multi-channel Digital REX.  Driven by DMS of antenna.  Next Gen ASARS will meet future operational requirements.

Text.val: Will design new chassis combining chassis Air Cooled Chassis #6 (ACC6) and Spray Cooled Chassis #7 (SCC7), re-design and relocate Field Support Equipment (FSE)/DCE, Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) and Encrypted File Server (EFS) (includes software).  Next Gen ASARS will meet future operational requirements.

Description.val: Upgrade Power System to increase safety, lower maintenance/support cost, address VVI/DMS issues, and support future avionics/payload upgrades included in the roadmap.

Text.val: Will upgrade A/C generator from the 45KVA to 65kVA to support future sensors requirements.

Title.val: Avionics  Processor (AVP) Upgrade/Airborne Recce Toolkit (ART) Analysis

Description.val: Update or Replace outdated/overburdened AVP.  Current AVP technology does not allow for upgrades and will not meet future requirements for the cockpit.

Text.val: Will Update or replace outdated/overburdened AVP.  Current AVP technology does not allow for upgrades and will not meet future requirements for the cockpit.

Description.val: Incorporates a backbone equipment bay onto the U-2 Airframe.  Provides additional payload capability for future systems.  Decrease aircraft drag from current design improving aircraft performance.

Text.val: Will incorporate a backbone equipment bay onto the U-2 Airframe.  Provides additional payload capability for future systems.  Decrease aircraft drag from current design improving aircraft performance.

Title.val: Airborne Signet Intelligence Payload (ASIP) Dual Pod Only Installation

Description.val: Reconfiguration of ASIP Line Replacement Units (LRU) to open SWAP in Q-bay while maintaining current capability.  This will allow additional payloads to be flown simultaneously with ASIP.

Text.val: Will design new chasis combining ACC6 and SCC7, re-design and relocate FSE/DCE, ATM and EFS (includes software)

Title.val: INS Upgrade and GPS Tech Refresh

Description.val: Replace/Update INS/GPS due to VVI/DMS Contexted/Degraded Operations (CDO)

Text.val: Will perform study to determine best way ahead.

OtherProgramFundingSummaryRemarks.val: A portion of funds in Airborne Reconnaissance Systems will be used to support sensor refurbishment.

AcquisitionStrategy.val: Modifications to existing platform and associated ground control equipment via Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs)/Task Orders on existing USAF contracts.  Details are classified and available on a need-to-know basis.  There is associated procurement funding tied to this development activity.

PerformanceMetrics.val: Please refer to the Performance Base Budget Overview Book for information on how Air Force resources are applied and how those resources are contributing to Air Force performance goals and most importantly, how they contribute to our mission.

Name.val: INS Upgrade and GPS Tech Refresh
